Tomorrow, Italian TV station RAI will show a documentary which exposes the use by the US of chemical weapons in Fallujah.
 
 The documentary can also already be seen here:
 
 http://www.rainews24.rai.it/ran24/inchiesta/default_02112005.asp
 
 WARNING
 The documentary is very graphic.

post_info.post_title: The US used chemical weapons in Fallujah

White phosphorus and napalm ( not actually called napalm anymore) while illegal I would not actually classify as chemical weapons.

White phosphorus and napalm ( not actually called napalm anymore) while illegal I would not actually classify as chemical weapons.

 White phosphorus is a chemical which is used as a weapon to indiscriminately kill anything it touches. This stuff burns away your skin to the bone.
 
 I'd definately call that a chemical weapon.

To me chemical weapons are more like Nerve Gas, Sarin etc. White phosphorus and Mark 77 firebombs ( New and improved Napalm ) are horrific weapons and were banned from using on live targets.
 
 White phosphorus though in action is more like an explosive or just being dosed with gasoline. The horrible thing is that using water to put out the burning only makes it worse.
 
 That the US military has been using WP and Napalm in Iraq should have been widely known. On a US news channel I remember seeing a tank firing a WP round into a house, leaving the very burnt remains of those within. Also on Iraqi Dispatch you can see the remains of Iraqi's from Fallujah who were very dead and very burnt.
I don't know if you've seen the documentary, but I suggest you should. WP more horrible than you can imagine.

Not saying it was nice
 
 Having viewed the corpses on another site that had pictures of Iraqis who were hit with WP and Mk 77 firebombs it would be a nasty way to go

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  The US used chemical weapons in Fallujah
